climbs.name: Mind if I do a J?

content.description: A steep start on chocolate patina leads straight up to a slab finish.
content.location: The right hand route on the wall.

content.description: Direct start to Killer Joe. Stick clip the 2nd bolt on Killer Joe, and start on a crimp rail in the otherwise-blank, dark face. Long moves on mostly good edges and sidepulls with awkward feet culminate in a tough move up to the clipping holds of the 2nd bolt of Killer Joe. Finish as for Killer Joe with easier climbing to a runout slab.Grade is a rough guess ~ boulder felt about V4, reach is useful. This one was much more enjoyable than the similarly bouldery route to its left, with a tricky and sustained entry sequence.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chain anchor. Pre-clip the second bolt on Killer Joe.
content.location: Left of Killer Joe, skipping the first bolt.

content.description: A steep start traverses slightly leftward and up to a slab finish.  There is a direct start TR that goes at 5.12.
content.location: The middle route on the wall.

content.description: There is a bouldery move on chocolate patina right off the bat that yields to easier climbing.  Depending on height/reach, this route might seem harder or easier than the reported grade.
content.location: The left hand route on the wall.

content.description: There are 4 TR routes located about 30-40 ft right of the climb "Mind if I do a J" on the J-Wall.  THEY ARE LISTED UNDER "The Hamlet". Anchors are accessible from above by scrambling along the terrace/slab at the right end of The Hamlet. The routes could probably be led trad.
content.protection: Fixed anchors on slab at right end of The Hamlet.

content.description: South facing solar collector of a crag with shelter from the wind.
